choices: You smile and say, "Of course I can sir."
You smile and say nothing.  After all, did he mean shut here or about the case?
Get up and leave.
1.content:
"Let me introduce myself. I am you, or actually, you are me. For this journey anyway. My name is Silver Rayn. Yes, my parents were hippies. I am of the female gender and I think I am very good at what I do. What is that? I am an FBI agent. A very good FBI agent.

"Now don't get nervous or anything. The case I'm about to embark on is bigger than any crime YOU could have committed. Or even thought of committing. My boss, Ryon Hammersby, is about to tell me about this very mission. Supposedly it's very hush hush so don't tell everyone."

You walk into a large office and stare at the tall muscular man behind the large desk. He sits with his large hands steepled before him, his elbows resting on the dark wood. His hair is perfect, brushed back in a professional way. He doesn't smile, never has, but sits waiting for you to sit.

The chair you choose to sit in is not one of the most comfortable chairs in the world but you've sat in it before. He clears his throat.

"If you don't think you can keep your mouth shut Agent Rayn leave now."
1.title: Who me?

choices: Elf of course.  Shoot those arrows, light as snow.  Hook me up!
Dwarf, that's me!  Sure they're short but they are great with weapons.
A changeling for sure!  I can be anything I need to be.  Hook me up!
A wizard!  Are you kidding?  Like there is any other choice.  Hook me up!
"Sir, you need help.  Seriously.  I'm outta here.  No offense."
11.content:
Ryon looks at you evilly. Oops, you think. "Well, Agent Rayn. This is a serious operation. I need tough, hard agents to handle it. I need to find something precious and, well, lets face it, imaginary."

"Imaginary?" You ask.

"Yes. It's called a unicorn. A mythical horse with a horn in the middle of its head believed to hold the serum of eternal life, blah, blah, blah. I need to find this creature." Ryon smiles. "You don't believe me."

"Well, sir, in my shoes would you believe you?" You ask.

"Huh?" Ryon wrinkles his forehead then shakes his head. "Never mind. I need to know if you'll take this assignment."

"Sure. And where do I find this unicorn?" You ask as you wonder when the last time was that Ryon got a catscan.

"You'll have to go deep undercover." Ryon says as he unsteeples his hands and leans forward.

"As what? An elf?" You ask as you snicker.

"Yes. Or something like it." Ryon stands and paces a moment. "An elf which will give you great strength and protection, a dwarf which will give you great wisdom and skill, a changeling which will allow you to fool almost any enemy, or a wizard and I don't need to say the benefits of that choice."

"Sir, how do I become these things? I can't learn such skills overnight." You say.

"Oh really? I thought you were the best." Ryon says.

"So did I." You mumble.

"I have potions, given to me by someone I can't name." Ryon smiles. "Well, choose."
11.title: Who am I?

choices: Duh!  Drink.
"Um, I usually eat before I drink, sir."
111.content:
"That's a no brainer, sir! Elves are so cool and collected. And they shoot like nobody's business. I'm telling you." You are beginning to get excited and you silently wonder if madness is catching.

"Here." He pulls a glass vial from the desk and hands it to you. There is nothing special about it. Just plain clear liquid.

"Are you sure this is elf serum, or whatever?" You ask.

"Of course. Drink." You hesitate. What is with the strange gleam in his eye? "Drink it, Rayn."

It's just water. It's just water. Yeah right, and this is a normal case. You stare at the vial while Ryon stares at you.
111.title: To Drink or Not To Drink?  That is the question.

choices: "She's ready.  Take her to the chamber."
1111.content:
The liquid burns on the way down. It started out cool on your tongue but in your throat it burns like fire. It hits your stomach like a lead weight. You cough.
"Wonderful!" Ryon stands and seems surprisingly menacing and tall. "Now it begins."
What, you ask. Or didn't ask. The word didn't leave your mouth and Ryon appears to be gloating. The room spins madly around you and you struggle to stay focused. You grasp the arms of your chair and blink your eyes rapidly.
"Bad wizard or good wizard. What kind of question was that, Rayn?" Ryon laughs and you feel like puking as the floor shifts beneath your feet. "Of course it was a bad wizard. No decent wizard would allow this to happen."
Your vision begins to go black around the edges. Your body screams in pain and you double over hoping if you do throw up you do it on Ryon's shoes. The room fades and you faint.
1111.title: Change

choices: Trust this elf and find out what he knows
Don't trust him, he could be another agent who is there to spy on you.
11111.content:
You awaken in a dark room. An elvish man is seated in a chair next to you. He has long silver hair and a golden circlet on his head. He seems to be about your age, but as far as you know he could be several thousand years old. You wonder, "Is this man to be trusted?" The man looks rather worn as though he has spent days without sleep. "Is he really an elf?" you wonder. "The ears and eyes are definitely elvish is style."

He stirs, for he was resting his eyes, and looks at you as though for the first time. "Hello, my name is Prince Lemli of the Woodland elves. I shall be your guide on your journey to save the unicorn," he said.

"I am Agent Silver Rayn," you reply. "How did you get in?"

"Mr. Ryon let me in. It was his idea that we save the unicorn. I mentioned it to him and he decided that his best agent would be on the job. He did not say that she was also an elf."

You get off of the couch and cross to the mirror. You are wearing the same clothes, but your ears are pointy and your other facial features are perfect and feline. Your eyes are as blue as the sea. There is something that you did not notice, though, until now. You have a purple birthmark on your left shoulder that is in the shape of a maple leaf. You've had it your entire life, but it was only a light strawberry color before. The prince noticed the birthmark at the same time you do and crosses the room to examine it.

"This is marvelous!" he exclaimed. "Who would have thought that the prophecies would come true through you?"

"What do you mean?"
11111.title: Undergone Changes

choices: "Very good, Agent Rayn.  Moving right along."
1112.content:
Ryon stares at you a moment then shakes his head. "I thought you were fearless."

"Fearless, yes, but not brainless. What, exactly does this do and who did you get it from?" You hold the vial tightly and watch your boss closely because as long as you can remember your boss has never been this anxious.

"This is an interesting twist, agent, you questioning me." Ryon smiles and returns to his chair. He sits and stares at you as if trying to intimidate you into backing down.

"Life is full of interesting twists, sir." You say calmly. "Like you turning me into an elf to go undercover to search for a unicorn."

"True. Well, it is a serum, that you know, given to me by Baladir, a wizard."

"Good or bad." You interrupt.

"Pardon?" Ryon seems dazed.

"A good wizard or a bad wizard?" You press as you feel the vial grow warm in your grasp.

"Does that really matter?" Ryon asks.

"Uh, yeah. That is the most important thing. Good intentions or bad intentions sets up the mood for the whole thing." You say.

"Hmmm. I didn't ask." Ryon says.

"Good detective work, sherlock." You mumble and regret it the minute he glares at you.

"Well?" Ryon demands.

You ponder the dangers and figure they compare to everyday. Well, everyday with a twisted storyline.

You uncork the vial. "Bottoms up, eh boss?" You say for lack of clever wit.

His smile is unusually evil as you down the cool liquid.
1112.title: Delays

choices: "She's ready.  Take her to the chamber."
11121.content:
The liquid burns on the way down. It started out cool on your tongue but in your throat it burns like fire. It hits your stomach like a lead weight. You cough.

"Wonderful!" Ryon stands and seems surprisingly menacing and tall. "Now it begins."

What, you ask. Or didn't ask. The word didn't leave your mouth and Ryon appears to be gloating.

The room spins madly around you and you struggle to stay focused. You grasp the arms of your chair and blink your eyes rapidly.

"Bad wizard or good wizard. What kind of question was that, Rayn?" Ryon laughs and you feel like puking as the floor shifts beneath your feet. "Of course it was a bad wizard. No decent wizard would allow this to happen."

Your vision begins to go black around the edges. Your body screams in pain and you double over hoping if you do throw up you do it on Ryon's shoes. The room fades and you faint.
11121.title: Change

choices: "I work alone, as always."  You say as you resist the urge to run.
"It would be nice to have backup."  You say.  "Justyn will work nice
111211.content:
Your head feels as though Ryon took a large mallet and used it to pound out the imperfections. Your mouth is dry as cotton and you don't even want to try and smile. You stand to your feet and feel a woosh of lightlessness. That's right, you're an elf now!

You open your eyes and the light seems to hurt them. You blink a few times and finally the world returns to focus. You are standing beside a small steel bed in a large white room. It gives the appearance of lifelessness and you feel it choking you.

"It is just the elf blood in you. Relax." Ryon's voice comes from some unseen speaker.

"You're a jerk, Ryon." You say as you swallow your panic.

"Aren't I?" He laughs. "Here's the deal Agent Rayn. If you chose to go alone on this journey, you will succeed because you are that good. If you go with Justyn, you will do well but he is too careful for your wild ways."

"People change." You say.

"Yes. I see that." Ryon mocks and you know he is talking of your recent transformation.

"I want a mirror." You say.

"Truly, Rayn, I never would have figured you for vain."

"You don't know me too well, Ryon." You say as the white walls part and color floods in. Ryon approaches carrying a small silver framed mirror.

"Beautiful, Rayn. Truly. I think this transformation was good for you." Ryon says as he reaches you and gently touches your cheek. "It brings out your best features."

"And your worse ones." You say as you swat his hand away. "Give me the mirror."

He hands you the mirror and you take a deep breath. Slowly, you bring the mirror up to your face and stare in shock. Your cheekbones are higher up and more defined, your eyes are a deep gray which was a color you always admired, your lips are slightly fuller with a natural healthy pink color and your slightly crooked nose straightened and looked pixie-like.

Ryon jerks the mirror from your hand. "You're falling in love with yourself." He says coldly.

"Better than falling in love with a jerk like you." You say because you know what he said was true.

"Well, choose. Do you want to work this case alone?" Ryon questions as the mirror seems to disappear. Something is not quite right about the whole chamber of white thing. "Or do you and Justyn work as a team again?" Ryon crosses his arms and you notice that his eyes are not brown like you originally thought. They are a yellowish green and actually quite ugly. You try to ignore the sinister smile as you think of your options.
111211.title: White Means Unpure

choices: Follow
Argue and stand your ground
1112111.content:
Ryon looks at you a moment as though he didn't expect that response.

"Justyn has already gone through the change." He says and you just smile.

"So?" You say, feeling brave.

"So you have a partner." Ryon concludes.

"Oh." You say. "Really." You stretch and enjoy the way your body feels, lithe and light.

"He is on his way from chamber four." Ryon states as he raises an eyebrow.

"Chamber four? Justyn and I aren't the only ones are we?" You ask feeling betrayed and used.

"No. We need the dwarf, changeling, elf and wizard for this journey. I like you so you were able to choose. Elf." Ryon laughs as though your choice was the wrong one. "Justyn is the wizard, of course. Meghan is the dwarf, my own little perfect revenge." Ryon laughs evilly and you stare.

"And the changeling?" You press when he doesn't continue.

"Oh, that's Erik." He states. Erik, your only competition, the only agent as talented and good as you.

"This sucks, Ryon." You say angrily.

"Doesn't it though? Follow me to the briefing room and I'll get you all started." Ryon turns and leaves. You follow, what else can you do?
1112111.title: Deception

choices: "This is no ordinary mission."  Ryon states.
11121111.content:
Normally you would argue and demand an apology and maybe an antidote to reverse your changes. And definitely request a catscan. But you follow. Must be the elf blood in you.

You walk down the hall and stare harshly at Ryon's back. He has seriously stepped on your toes here. You wish he had already given you your arrows so you could shoot him in the back.

But then you wouldn't be able to be Silver Rayn again. Elves are cool and everything but who wants to be one forever?

You enter the large conference room at the end of the hall where the other three are waiting for you. Justyn sits at the head of the table looking not at all different. But one thing you notice is that he radiates with power. He is suddenly very intimidating. His reddish blond hair is still clean cut and neat, no beard touched his face and his brown eyes remain focused on you.

Meghan sits to his right. Once a very beautiful agent, her tall shapely figure is small and bulky, her nose large and bulbous, her eyes small and beady. You feel bad for her and even angrier at Ryon.

Erik, in all his glory. As a changeling he has kept his smug features and handsome ruggedness. His thick black hair hangs to his shoulders loose and his green eyes caress your face. You silently wish you had never slept with him but that's the past. It's forgotten. At least you act like it is.

"Rayn. Definitely an improvement. You as an elf is definitely turning me on." Erik says in his silky voice.

"You as a changeling on my mission is definitely making me sick." You reply and Meghan snickers.

"What are you laughing at, dwarf?" Erik sneers.

"Enough." Ryon barks and you sit. "I don't need to tell you who's in charge. You answer to Rayn and she decides when to act. I am counting on you agents. Let's get on with it."
11121111.title: The Team

choices: "Let's go to the transporter room."
111211111.content:
"Master of the obvious strikes again." You mumble and Ryon ignores you.

"The unicorn, mythical creature said to hold the serum to eternal life. The beast exists. And I know where." Ryon smiles.

"What do we want it for?" Meghan asks in a deep dwarf voice.

"Eternal life." Ryon states. "Eternal youth. The thing dreams are made of. You will be sent to the Woods of Unholy Blood where you will meet with Snarl, a troll, who will direct you to the path of the unicorn. I expect status reports often and if I do not hear from you I will have to assume the worst."

"What? That the fairies got us and carried us off to pixie land to hang out with Peter Pan and Captain Hook." Justyn asks and Ryon opens his mouth to correct him. "Ah, ah, ah." Justyn replies and smiles. "I'm a wizard remember."

You try not to laugh but a smile tugs at your lips. You look away from Justyn and your eyes fall on Erik who is staring at you strangely.

"Be careful. Watch your backs. There are dangerous creatures there." Ryon states.

"Why are we doing this?" You ask. "And don't give me crap about eternal life. I want to know."

"You'll find out soon enough." Ryon says, and something about his tone freezes your heart and puts fear in your very soul.
111211111.title: Shadows On The Wall

choices: Enter The Woods
1112111111.content:
The transporter room. Cold, sterile and white. It was worse than the chamber you woke up in. The four of you stand in the center of the room waiting for more information. Then you notice the weapons.

Piled in the corner is a large, heavy looking battle-axe, trimmed in gold and silver. Definitely for the dwarf. There is also a short sword, which you assume is for the dwarf as well.
You see your quiver of arrows and your bow and you feel a thrill of excitement. You have always admired the elfshot that was rumored to belong to elves. You see the two thin bladed daggers and a long sword with a sharp looking blade.

There are other daggers and swords, plain looking yet strong, mixed in. You step forward to claim your weapons.

"Anxious are we?" Ryon asks, his tone frosty.

"Afraid are we?" You counter as you strap the quiver to your back and loop the bow over it. You strap a dagger to each thigh and that is when you notice your clothing. You were so comfortable you didn't even notice that you were even dressed like an elf. "Where did you get these clothes?" You ask.

"The same place I got the weapons, Agent." Ryon replies.

"Wonderful." You say as the snatch up the long sword and belt it to your hip. "How do I look?" You ask.

"Delicious." Erik replies as he stands near you. You can feel his breath on your neck as he leans in and whispers, "Divine. Good enough to eat."

"Don't make me hurl." You say as you shrug. The others gather their weapons and you look around. Ryon is gone. "When did he leave?" You ask but no one answers.

"Take care, Agents. And bring me back the unicorn. Alive." The disembodied voice of Ryon fills the room.

"Why didn't he come on this mission if it was so important to him?" Meghan asks bitterly.

"Because he's a chicken." You reply as the white glows brighter and causes you to shut your eyes.

"Or because he's smart." Justyn replies somewhere beside you.

"Whatever the reason, you can be sure I'm going to find out his intentions." You say. "Even if it kills me."

There is a loud noise followed by darkness. Then a gust of air and suddenly you hear birds and smell fresh air. You open your eyes. You are standing in front of a large forest. The trees are the color of blood, deep red. You smile softly because you realize that Ryon has sent you all on a fool's errand and that the only way to succeed is to survive.
1112111111.title: Departure

choices: "We go right."  You say as you start off.
"Left it is.  It'll be easier."  You agree.
11121111111.content:
"The Woods of Unholy Blood. What would a unicorn be doing here?" You ask no one in particular. You are not interested in the answer, you just want to voice your fears without stating the obvious.

"Who says the unicorn is here? We need to meet Snarl, remember? The troll." Justyn replies as he steps toward the trees.

"A troll and a unicorn. An elf and a changeling. This is too much for me. I can't believe he made me a dwarf. Who in their right mind would pick a dwarf?" Meghan asks as she follows Justyn.

No one replies because despite the advantages of being a dwarf the disadvantages were far worse.

In a line with Justyn in the lead, then Meghan, you and finally Erik taking up the rear, you march into the woods. Immediately you smell it, your senses much keener than the others.

"Blood." You murmur.

"Unholy Blood." Erik replies. "Kind of romantic if you ask me."

"I didn't." You say and quicken your pace.

"But, my sweet elf, you will." Erik says with a laugh and you silently vow to get revenge on Ryon and Erik after this is over. "There. Up ahead. There's a fork." Erik says.

You look right to left as the four of you come to a halt at the fork in the path. The right is dense and faint, as though rarely ever traveled. The left is wide and airy with room enough to walk by twos.

"Which way do we go?" Meghan asks.

You think. "Wide is the path to destruction, Narrow is the road less traveled." You say.

"Scripture in a fairy tale. I never thought I'd live to see the day." Erik remarks.

"Let's vote." Justyn says.

"I say left." Meghan replies.

"Same here." Erik states as he watches you from the corner of his eye.

"I agree." Justyn smiles.

"Three against one." Meghan replies.

"Right! We go left." Erik starts off.

"Wait. I choose. I decide. Votes only let me know your desires." You say, wondering why you hesitate to take the wide and easy path.

"Well, then, which way, oh great elf?" Erik asks snidely.

"I'm not sure. Give me a minute." You say. You think of surviving, which has suddenly become the focus of the mission. Which way? You hold four lives in your hands. You shut your eyes and go with your gut feeling.
11121111111.title: It Isn't Easy Being You

choices: Night Falls.  Make camp for the night.
Night Falls.  Press on for awhile longer.
111211111111.content:
"You did that just to piss me off." Erik says as he chases after you and grabs hold of your arm. "We go left because we voted and because it will be easier."

"Easier," You say as you shrug off his hand. "Is not always better."

"Let's just go, Erik. We're burning daylight here." Justyn says as he brushes past you and heads right, down the narrow path. Erik glares at you a moment then falls in behind Justyn. Meghan stands beside you. It is weird looking down on the woman you always had to tilt your head back to look at.

"Well done, Rayn. You are probably right about the path." She says before she follows the others. You look back at the easier path and start when you see a black cloaked figure standing further up the path. He lifts his hand and a ball of light flares up. You stumble backwards and a small cry escapes your lips. You don't reach for your weapons for you know no weapon can harm this man. He is a wizard.

Suddenly Justyn stands before you. He moves his hands rapidly as the ball of light speeds toward you. It slams harmlessly into an invisible shield. The man screams angrily then vanishes. Justyn turns and smiles and he suddenly looks very handsome to you.

"I saw him, which is why I didn't argue. I didn't think he would try anything though." Justyn begins to walk down the narrow path again toward where Meghan and Erik stand waiting. "Pretty good, huh?" Justyn asks over his shoulder as you fall into step beside him.

"I'm not complaining." You say as you catch up to the others and the four of you walk deeper into the dark forest.
111211111111.title: Dangers Unseen

choices: Morning!  Rise and shine!
1112111111111.content:
"Lets set up camp." You say as the woods get very dark. Even though elves have very good night vision, you hesitate in leading your team deeper into the woods. You find a clearing and sit upon the ground.

"Great." Meghan grumbles. "He didn't give us any supplies."

"We would have been a little obvious with tents and army surplus." Justyn replies gently. He murmurs a word and a fire appears in the midst of the clearing. "Just for light, no warmth. I don't want to attract creatures or burn the forest down."

You nod, too tired to comment. Erik sits across from you and stares into the trees.

"Who was that on the path to the left?" He asks finally.

"I am not certain but I believe it to be Baladir." Justyn says.

"Baladir?" You ask. "But he is the wizard who wanted us to find the unicorn."

"Yes. His spell was a warning. Nothing more. If he meant to kill you, we would not have seen it coming."

"Comforting." You say as you lay back on the soft grasses. You shut your eyes and can't believe how comfortable the ground is. As you begin to drift you think of the dangers looming ahead. You try not to let your last thought be Ryon but it is.

Your night is a tangle of nightmares. You can't wake, you can't escape. You lie sleeping peacefully on the outside, no tossing or turning but inside you see the hooded man's face. The man on the trail was not Baladir, he was Ryon.
1112111111111.title: Dreams and Nightmares

choices: Let them go.  You and Justyn will proceed alone.
Force them to follow you.  You are the leader after all.
11121111111111.content:
You wake and feel not the least bit disoriented. Justyn is the only other person awake at the moment. You stand and stretch as you take in your surroundings. The trees are redder than ever in the morning sunlight that filters through the leaves above. The fire no longer burns and the area where it sat is untouched. You are secretly impressed by Justyn's skills.

"Good morning Agent Rayn." Justyn says softly as he stares at a blood red tree before him. "Welcome to Hell."

"That is a little harsh, Justyn." You say as a chill slips down your spine.

"A little." He says then he tears his gaze from the unnatural bark. "I don't think that was Baladir. I had a dream." He looks at the others to make sure they are not listening. "I think it was Hammersby."

You shrug, trying to act as though it doesn't bother you that someone else dreamt as you did. "I know. I dreamt the same dream." You say.

"That should comfort, I guess. We are all a little upset at Ryon. Maybe we placed him as a threat in the dream." Justyn says as he stands. "We should get going."

"Of course." You say and proceed to wake Meghan. Justyn kicks Erik gently in the side. You and Meghan step into the trees to use the bathroom and freshen up a bit. Being an elf did have it's advantages but you were not going to wander around smelling like grass and pine needles.

"Forget it!" Erik's voice reaches you and you begin to rush back to camp. "I'm sick of being disregarded! I should be leading."

"Should you?" You ask as you enter the clearing where Justyn is standing with his hands on his hips. Erik is fuming, hands clenched at his side.

"Yes. I should." He says.

"Ryon didn't think so. And neither do I. We need to move on. We have no time for petty differences now." You say as you start down the path.

"I'm taking the left fork." Erik says to your back. You stop and turn to face him.

"Didn't you see what happened yesterday?" You ask.

"Yes. Baladir warned you. You're taking us the wrong way." Erik says.

You look at Justyn who shakes his head. No, that wasn't what the warning was, his eyes tell you. You look at Erik as Meghan goes to stand beside him.

"I think Erik is right. We should go left." She says.

"It's up to Rayn. You decide if they go their way or if they follow you. We both know the left fork is the wrong fork." Justyn replies.

"Fine." You say as you make your decision.
11121111111111.title: The Crossroads Again

choices: Check it out.  Maybe there's a bed.
Forget it.  You can sleep just as easily outside.
111211111111111.content:
"Go to the left fork if you feel you must. Maybe they meet up further in. We should have split up in the first place." You say as you wonder who you would have taken with you if you had to have chosen the day before.

Erik looks madder than ever. "Fine." He growls as he turns and heads back down the path. Meghan sends you a look of apology and you nod to show she is forgiven. You can't force them to believe or feel one way or another. You watch them until they disappear through the trees.

"Let's go." Justyn says and the two of you trek up the path.

"Will they be alright?" You ask after a few moments pass.

"I hope so. They chose what they knew to be wrong and went against your leadership. You did the right thing by letting them go." Justyn has set a fast pace and you easily keep up.

"What do you think is on the left path?" You ask.

"I didn't want to say anything yesterday but I felt a pull. A strange tugging calling me to that path. Riches and gifts. Stuff like that. I would have gone too if you hadn't stood your ground yesterday. You didn't feel it?" He asks.

You think back to yesterday. "No. All I felt was uneasy." You say.

"Being an elf must be wonderful." Justyn says and you smile. The two of you march through the forest, silent and contemplative. You silently hope you run into Erik and Meghan again.

Close to evening you reach a small mud hut. You and Justyn look at each other in silent question. "What do you think?" You ask.

"Well, hopefully it's uninhabited. We can stay the night there if it is." He says.

"So we should check it out." You say.

"Only if you feel right about it." He replies as he rotates his shoulders.

"What about you? Do you feel anything?" You ask.

"No." Justyn says. "You?"

"No." You smile.
111211111111111.title: The Wizard and The Elf

choices: "Wake up, Rayn.  We have company."  Justyn says.
1112111111111111.content:
You nod and you both proceed cautiously to the small hut. You wonder if it could be a trap. A little late your inner warning system explodes.

"Oh no." You say but it is too late. The hut vanishes and a small wrinkled old woman stands before you.

"An elf and a wizard. My, my, my." It cackles and you shake your head. "And what brings you to the Woods of Unholy Blood?" She asks.

"Snarl." Justyn says.

"Ah, yes. Snarl." The hag spits. "I need you to pay the toll."

"And what is the toll?" You ask not really wanting to know the answer.

"One of you must die." She says.

"Too high of a price." Justyn says and you feel power surround you. Justyn has placed a protective shield around the two of you. "We have gold." He adds though you both know you don't.

"Ah, gold. I need food." She says.

Suddenly you are struck with an idea. "Elf is tough meat to chew and magic toughens a wizards soul. But there is a dwarf and a changeling on the left path." You feel a moment’s guilt but it fades when you realize the name of the game: Survival.

"I don't believe you." She hisses.

"I will show you." Justyn says as he weaves a spell that shows Erik and Meghan trudging slowly down a wide path.

"The left fork." She smiles a hideous toothless smile. "I will have me changeling and dwarf this night." And she's gone. You look at Justyn.

"We betrayed them." You say.

"And warned them. They could see us and we could see them. They know she is coming." Justyn removed the shield. "Let's go. We are not camping anywhere near here."

You agree and you head down the path again. The woods are getting darker. "Should we stop?" You ask.

"I wouldn't dare." Justyn replies as he stops and picks up a stick. He mumbles a word and a small ball of light appears on the end. "This will help me see. You're alright with your elf sight."

"Are we being followed?" You ask.

"Yes." He says. You trudge on silently and quickly and are surprised that you are not tired.

Many hours later you reach another small clearing. "This will work." He says as he sits against a tree. "Stay close, Rayn." You sit beside him and he extiguishes the light. "Sleep." He says and you suddenly feel very tired.

"You spelled me." You accuse.

"Earlier when I knew we couldn't stop I spelled both of us. That is why we made it so far without feeling tired. Now I have removed the spell so we feel the repercussions." He yawns loudly and you smile in the darkness. You lean against the tree and shut your eyes. You silently pray that Erik and Meghan received your warning and acted accordingly. Survival is on your mind when you drift off but you dream of a hooded man watching you sleep. Ryon stands above you smiling his evil smile. And though you know it's a dream you still feel the reality of his gaze.

choices: "We go to Mandisor.  We need to know the truth."  You say.
"I wouldn't want to be left behind.  Let's find them."
11121111111111111.content:
You open your eyes assuming that you will be too tired to stand but are refreshed. You are shocked when you look up and see the sun shining directly down through the branches overhead. Noon!

You look around and see a huge ugly creature standing before you and Justyn. It is a pale green color and it has coarse looking black hair everywhere. It's clothes are made from dead animals and his teeth are thick and yellow. It's eyes glare at you from under monstrous eyebrows and his nose is large and crooked. He is bulky and huge with arms and legs the size of tree trunks and he holds a crude looking club in his hand.

"Troll." You say.

"Snarl." Justyn replies.

"I hope so." You stand and the troll grimaces. The smell is almost too much for you to take, a mix of urine and spoiled meat.

"Snarl?" You say loudly.

"Yes." Is the gruff reply you hear. Justyn stands beside you.

"Where is the unicorn?" You ask.

"Where is the changeling? And the dwarf?" Snarl asks and you are surprised that he speaks so clearly.

"On the left fork." Justyn says truthfully.

"The fools!" Snarl, well, snarls. "They will die!"

"We tried to tell them." Justyn says.

"You should have stopped them!" Snarl shakes his large head. "The unicorn is not in the Woods of Unholy Blood." He says

"I know." You say.

"Elf, don't be wise." Snarl says and you hide a smile.

"Where is the unicorn?" Justyn asks.

"In the Valley of Serenity on the border of Mandisor and Merrick, protected by the fairies and the queen." Snarl says. "I was supposed to keep the dwarf here. Now what do I do?"

"Why?" You ask.

"The Dark Lord demands it." Snarl says.

"You know where the left fork leads. Capture her." Justyn says.

"Even I won't venture down the wide path." Snarl says. You and Justyn exchange glances. "Follow this path out, you are five miles or so from the edge of the forest. Take care for the land of Mandisor is full of dangers far worse than the Woods of Unholy Blood have to offer. Do not return until you have the unicorn." Snarl turns to leave then he looks back at you. "Do not fail or I will have to kill you." Snarl says and he crashes down the path and out of sight.

"Big guy." Justyn says.

"Big trouble." You say.

"Did you dream of Ryon again?" Justyn asks.

"Yes. He watched us sleep." You say and Justyn nods.

"He watches more than that. Come on. I don't want to spend another night here." Justyn says.

"What about Erik and Meghan?" You ask. The trolls warning scared you.

"We can't go looking for them. We can't fail this mission." Justyn said.

"And what do you consider failure?" You ask.

"Death." He says simply. "I could care less if Ryon gets the unicorn or not. I think there is more to this than meets the eye and I want to make sure I'm on the side of good."

"That's how I feel." You say.

"If we go back to the left fork we're committing suicide." Justyn says. "Besides, they're probably already dead."

"Maybe." You say though you are not wholly convinced. "Still..."

"It's up to you Rayn. I follow you." Justyn says finally and you admit that he is the most loyal agent you have found. But once again you are forced to make a decision that will end in life or death...for you.
11121111111111111.title: It's Still Not Easy Being You

choices: Survey the land then evaluate your next move.
Step out, it looks peaceful enough.
111211111111111111.content:
Justyn smiles at you as though he knew you would say that. The two of you begin the silent trek through the remainder of the woods. You feel slightly uneasy as the color of the trees begin to seem natural to you. You know there is no way a blood red tree with gray leaves would ever be natural. You shudder as you walk beside Justyn.

"Rayn, I must say I am impressed." He says.

"Are you?" You reply.

"Yes. I never thought we would get along this well. Remember the mission five years ago?" He asks.

You nod. How could you forget it? You had jumped at the chance to get away from Erik since the terrible night when you came to him. Foolish you knew but it had been a bad couple of weeks and you needed comfort. Or something like it.

"Well, I have no desire to bring up the past but you look mighty good as an elf." Justyn looks at you lustily.

"Justyn. Only you would think of sex while you're a wizard and I'm an elf. This mission is strange enough without fatal attractions making it worse." You smile smugly as Justyn looks slightly chastised.

"There!" He says pointing. Sure enough, before you unfolds the fresh green landscape of Mandisor. You study the fresh peaceful looking land and wonder why Snarl would have had such a negative outlook on the land. Justyn begins to step into the sunlight but you halt him by placing your hand on his arm.

"What is it, Rayn? Reconsidering my offer?" He asks with a lifted eyebrow and a twinkle in his eye.

"Reconsidering the trolls words actually." You say. "We need to use caution here." You look behind you then turn your gaze back to the blinding sunlight. "We need to use extreme caution."

Justyn looks at you a moment then frowns. In the silence you consider your options.
111211111111111111.title: The Past

choices: Dawn Approaches, time to move on.
1112111111111111112.content:
"Well, I must say it doesn't look terribly dangerous to me." Justyn says as he looks at you from the corner of his eye.

"I agree. Although that is usually the first sign that it is dangerous." You say.

"Rayn, how did I ever end up with an optimist like you?" Justyn mocks and you smile.

"Ryon said you were too cautious for me. Who's the cautious one?" You joke and you both laugh. "Well, I guess if we feel good enough to laugh we should believe the danger to be not as great as we hypothesized." You say.

"Unless it's just the sunlight and the natural green color that has lightened our moods, I am likely to agree with you." Justyn said as you both step into the sunlight.

The air is fresh and remarkable. You never realized you could get used to the smell of dried blood but now that you inhale the fresh air you realize you had done just that. You stroll calmly as the thigh high grass sways in a gentle breeze.

"Rayn." Justyn says after a moments silence.

"Yes."

"Do you love Erik? I mean, not like I care, truly, but he's kind of a jerk, you know. And, I mean, it's just you're too good for him." Justyn runs a hand up and down his neck as though uncomfortable.

"Believe me, Justyn, I discovered that long ago." You smile and pluck a blade of the tall grass. Still moving forward, you twine it into a ring and are secretly impressed by the neatness and style of it. "I can't believe it." You mutter.

"What?" Justyn asks anxiously. He seems to be hanging on your every word.

"Check this out." You say as you hand him the ring.

"That's very nice, Rayn, but you haven't truly answered my question." He says.

"Oh?" You bite your lip and think. "Erik was a foolish time in my life. I guess I was confused and enamored and impressed all at once. He is a great agent after all."

"So are you." Justyn whispers and you feel strange. Was Justyn truly interested in you? This was an unexpected turn of events. Of course, becoming an elf, searching a strange land for a mythical creature for you boss at the FBI was not exactly normal.

"Well, I guess we were wrong to fear this place. Maybe Snarl doesn't like it because of the fresh smell." You say, changing the subject.

"Hmm." Justyn says then stops walking. You stop as well and face him.

"What is it?" You say, although you don't feel any warnings you trust Justyn's instincts nearly as well as your own.

"This." Justyn says and he takes your hand and places the ring on your finger. You look down at it. It is gold! The intricate weaving of the grass blade remains but Justyn has turned it into solid gold.

"Wow." You say.

"My thoughts exactly." Justyn whispers in your ear. You look up and he kisses you, softly and passionately on the lips. Despite all reason you allow him to lay you down in the tall grass, many blades bending beneath you. He breaks the embrace and smiles at you. "Agent Rayn, may I have the honor of making love to you in this strange place?" He asks.

"Justyn, maybe we should-" You begin but he interrupts you with another kiss.

"Agent Rayn, may I have the honor of making love to you in this strange place?" He asks again.

"Yes." You say and you give in to the emotions that swirl within you. You and Justyn...together. Even as he kisses you, you know that this may be more than lust.

You may actually love him.




The daylight fades as you and Justyn lay in each other’s arms. You think silently that this may have been a mistake. Just as that thought enters your mind, Justyn turns to you.

"Rayn, I think I may love you." He says.

You smile. "I think it may be catching." He kisses you and there is no more talk.
1112111111111111112.title: A Peaceful Interlude, A Time For Love

11121111111111111121.content:
You wake up and stretch, enjoying the sun on your face. Suddenly you are aware of eyes watching you. You open your eyes and look at Erik, standing above you, his eyes blazing.

"If I had known you were a whore, Rayn, I would have screwed you more often." Erik says angrily.

You sit up quickly to slide your shirt on and notice that you are fully clothed already. You look at Justyn who smiles. He had clothed you once he woke.

"How dare you say that to me?" You say, glad that Justyn thought of your dignity. "You have no right to insult me."

"Oh, yeah?" Erik raises an eyebrow. "I know you and Romeo had a little thing going after you and me. I come into this meadow and find the two of you lying in the grass together." Erik leans close. "You are a whore! A little elven whore!"

"Enough." Justyn says calmly. "What Rayn does is none of your concern. We need to move on. Where is Meghan?"

"Dead probably. Snarls lunch." Erik says coldly as he straightens and runs his fingers through his hair. You silently wonder how you could ever have found him handsome. "He said he had to keep her there. If this continues, only Rayn will find the unicorn."

"No glory for you, huh?" Justyn asks as he stands and helps you up.

"Isn't that touching? A tender moment between lovers." Erik spits into the grass and you long to shoot him in the butt. As you think of Erik moaning in the grass, clutching an arrow graced buttock you giggle. "What?" Erik demands.

"I can show you." You say as you reach for an arrow. As Erik stares at you in confusion, Justyn halts your process.

"We need to decide what to do from here?" Justyn says. "And I don't think what you have in mind will help."

"Alright." You say. "We continue on and pray we come upon the Valley of Serenity soon."

"The Valley of Serenity? What's there?" Erik asks.

"The unicorn." You and Justyn say in unison.

"Who told you that lie?" Erik asks.

"Snarl." Justyn says.

"It's not a lie, Erik." You say.

"Snarl told me the unicorn lay that way." Erik replies as he points west. "Past the Valley of Lost Things and in the land of Ellonier."

"Now we have a problem." Justyn says and you frown. That is a problem. Who did he tell the truth to and why did he lie at all? You think for a moment then you decide.
11121111111111111121.title: Anger Management And Another Tough Choice

The Valley of Lost Things.
111211111111111111211.content:
"Regardless of who he lied to, we all agree that Snarl lied." You strap on your weapons and look at Justyn who nods.

"I agree." he says.

"You would." Erik replies. He starts off, intent on leading even if his destination was considered the untruth.

"Anyway," Justyn continues as you and him fall into step behind him. "The name itself speaks of peace and you'd assume a unicorn would exist in such a place."

"Maybe." Erik said. "You know, they say the unicorn was being protected but maybe the unicorn is being held prisoner."

You and Justyn look at each other and frown. For once what Erik said made sense.

"Just a thought." Erik added, misjudging your silence for disbelief.

"Sounds like something Hammersby would dream up." You say.

"Ryon? What about him?" Erik asks. You suddenly notice how long this meadow truly is. You glance behind your shoulder. You haven't gained any distance from the trees. You look down at your feet and see them moving through the grass, giving the appearance of progress.

"Uh, we're not moving." You say. Justyn looks at you and frowns. "You noticed?"

"Yes. I noticed." Justyn says.

"So, what do we do?" Erik asks.

"We press on." Justyn says. "Maybe we'll get there eventually."

"When we're dying." Erik replies as he stops walking and faces you. "Rayn?"

"Well, we either press on or we go to the Valley of Lost Things." You smile. "Choose." You say.

choices: "Back to the woods?"  Justyn suggests.

"If Snarl intended for you and I to return to the woods in search of the truth he does not desire to give us he underestimated me." You say as Justyn nods.

"So?" Erik asks bitterly.

"The Valley of Lost Things seems a good destination." You say.

"Told you so." Erik says.

"Out with what?" You ask finally sick of Erik standing in front of you staring at you.

"Who do you want?" Erik demands.

"What?" You ask as you look over at Justyn who just shakes his head.

"I'm not going a step further until I know your intentions, elf!" Erik snaps.

I have no intention of continuing a relationship with you or discussing my choices with you. I want to reach the Valley of Lost Things and get this over with." 12.content:
You sit there and Ryon looks at you evilly. "Well, Agent Rayn?"
Oops, you think. "Um, sure sir. What's going on?"
"This is a serious operation." He says after a moments pause. "I need tough, hard agents to handle it. I need to find something precious and, well, lets face it, imaginary."
"Imaginary?" You ask.
"Yes. It's called a unicorn. A mythical horse with a horn in the middle of it's head believed to hold the serum of eternal life, blah, blah, blah. I need to find this creature." Ryon smiles. "You don't believe me."
"Well, sir, in my shoes would you believe you?" You ask.
"Huh?" Ryon wrinkles his forehead then shakes his head. "Never mind. I need to know if you'll take this assignment."
"Sure. And where do I find this unicorn?" You ask as you wonder when the last time was that Ryon got a catscan.
"You'll have to go deep undercover." Ryon says as he unsteeples his hands and leans forward.
"As what? An elf?" You ask as you snicker.
"Yes. Or something like it." Ryon stands and paces a moment. "An elf which will give you great strenth and protection, a dwarf which will give you great wisdom and skill, a changeling which will allow you to fool almost any enemy, or a wizard and I don't need to say the benefits of that choice."
"Sir, how do I become these things? I can't learn such skills overnight." You say.
"Oh really? I thought you were the best." Ryon says.
"So did I." You mumble.
"I have potions, given to me by someone I can't name." Ryon smiles. "Well, choose."

121.content:
"Elves are so cool and collected. And they shoot like nobody's business. I'm telling you." You are beginning to get excited and you silently wonder if madness is catching.
"Here." He pulls a glass vial from the desk and hands it to you. There is nothing special about it. Just plain clear liquid.
"Are you sure this is elf serum, or whatever?" You ask.
"Of course. Drink." You hesitate. What is with the strange gleam in his eye? "Drink it, Rayn."
It's just water. It's just water. Yeah right, and this is a normal case. You stare at the vial while Ryon stares at you.

The liquid burns on the way down. It started out cool on your tongue but in your throat it burns like fire. It hits your stomach like a lead weight. You cough.

What, you ask. Or didn't ask. The word didn't leave your mouth and Ryon appears to be gloating. The room spins madly around you and you struggle to stay focused. You grasp the arms of your chair and blink your eyes rapidly.

Your vision begins to go black around the edges. Your body screams in pain and you double over hoping if you do throw up you do it on Ryon's shoes. The room fades and you faint.

"This is great! I am a wizard! What's this? A rat? Hocus pocus may the rat be a friendly elf!" said Silver and the rat turned into an elf.

"Hi, my name's Stee. How may I be of assistance to you?" asked Stee.

"Yes master," said Stee going over to Silver handing her her wand.

"Thank you Stee," said Silver.

         All of the sudden, Ryon comes by and comes into the chamber. He looks at Silver from head to toe. He raises an eyebrow and begins to speak.

"I see that you've finally accepted becoming the wizard and have already casted your first spell. Now, do you feel that you're ready? Will you and your elf take my assignment?" asked Ryon eagerly.

"Good. I want you to travel to different countries to try to find the unicorn. I'll allow you to pick and choose the way you want to travel to them. I suggest trying England first since they seem to have so many legends based from there to begin with," said Ryon continuing to stare at the elf.

"Yes, I'm going to travel by wand. My elf's name is Stee by the way. I know you're interested in him," said Silver.

"All right, go ahead then," said Ryon leaving the chambers.

"This looks great!" said Stee stuffing his face with some cherry pie.

"Yes indeed it does!" said Silver making up a large plate of everything.

         All of the sudden, an unusual squawking sound can be heard somewhere near by. Silver and Stee stare at each other. They wonder if they should stop eating and go look or go see what it is. They wouldn't mind not continuing to eat anyway since they were full now.

"Yes, that's a griffin," said Stee.

"I wonder why he's squawking?" asked Silver curiously.

"Listen! It sounds as though he's hungry. Let me go back and bring the rest of that chicken for him," said Stee.

"No, the bones might get caught in his throat. I'm going to make a whole bunch of fish appear near him instead. I bet he'd love salmon. Here it goes...hocus pocus may many salmon appear!" said Silver waving her magic wand.

"Squawk, squawk!" said the griffin stuffing its beak with tons of salmon.

"Well, that takes care of him," said Silver.

"Yes," said Stee.

"It's getting dark. Should we continue to look or camp and sleep for the night Stee?" asked Silver.

"Let's camp and sleep for the night," suggested Stee.

"Sounds good. It's already getting too dark to see now anyway. Poor griffin must have not had a good food source to be hungry like that," said Silver.
